config.question: What led to the outbreak of hostility against Chinese people in the late 1800s that was known as the so-called “Yellow Peril?”

choices.content: Chinese immigrants came to the United States, taking many of the jobs that other people felt they deserved.
After the bombing of Pearl Harbor, Japanese immigrants were seen as a threat to national security.
Chinese Americans were well educated and began to take high-paying and prestigious jobs, to the outrage of whites.
While Chinese immigrants embraced cultural assimilation, Japanese immigrants had a harder time fitting in, leading many Americans to discriminate against them.
